intro: Acetosella hapalconidea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sorrel, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers during the spring season. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Acetosella hapalconidea is a perennial species that is well adapted to cool, temperate climates.
